issue.title: Convert values to Starlark values when concating string_list_dict type

labels.name: team-Starlark-Interpreter
labels.description: Issues involving the Starlark interpreter used by Bazel

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Convert values to Starlark values when concating string_list_dict type.

This is because Dict checks that all the values put in it are Starlark valid values. But string_list_dict value is of type List<String>, when Java's List isn't a Starlark value.

Fixes #23065

My first PR to bazel :star_struck: Would love you to review the PR.
 Checked that the test didn't pass before the change and did after it.

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 7.4.0 RC1](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/7.4.0rc1). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting `USE_BAZEL_VERSION=7.4.0rc1`. Thanks!
